body.p:
Louisville 15th July 1861 --
To His Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Govr of Kentucky --
Respected Sir

I was fined in the city court of Louisville $25 for an alledged assault upon Betsy Thornberry, both of us are free persons of colour, & were emancipated in this county by John Murphy an old citizen. We live in the same house which was given us in common, by our late Master & when approaching my room was attacked by sd Betsy by throwing water upon me from a tub, which I took up afterwards & pushed her away this is the truth she sd more harm was done her none witnessed it but ourselves & she did not tell the true state of the case, in these times I am not able to pay the fine & costs which together amount to $38. & 45.cts I pray yr Excellency to remit the fine I am humbly yr servt
We join in the prayer of petitioner to remit his fine, he is an orderly well behaved & industrious negro & has, when needed been employed in the Pickett tobacco ware house here but not constantly

Louisville City Ct
$25. } assault
Jno. Murphy
